com.ing.software.ocr

Class ImagePreprocessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ing.software.ocr.ImagePreprocessor

  • public class ImagePreprocessor
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to process an image of a ticket.

    This class is thread safe.

    USAGE CASES:

    Real time visual feedback when framing a ticket:

      Create new ImagePreprocessor passing a the bitmap of the preview frame.
      Call findTicket(true)
      If findTicket returns NONE, call getCorners to get the rectangle corners to overlay on top of preview.
      Call getCorners to get a rectangle (if findTicket returns NONE) or a polygon (if findTicket returns RECT_NOT_FOUND).

    User shoots a photo:

      Use ImageProcessor instance of last frame when rectangle was found.
      Call findTicket(false);
      If findTicket returns NONE proceed to step 5)
      If findTicket returns RECT_NOT_FOUND, let user drag the rectangle corners into position, then proceed to call setCorners().
      Call OcrManager.getTicket passing this ImagePreprocessor instance. Call undistort to get the photo of the ticket unwarped.

    New photo loaded from storage:

      Same as when user shot a photo, but ImagePreprocessor must be created with loaded photo.

    Load and show photo already processed:

      Create new ImagePreprocessor passing the photo and the corners.
      Call undistort().
    Author:
    Riccardo Zaglia

    • Method Detail

      • setImage

        public void setImage(android.graphics.Bitmap bm)
        Set content of internal image buffers. Always call this method before any other image manipulation method.
        Parameters:
        bm - ticket bitmap

      • findTicket

        public void findTicket(boolean quick,
                       com.annimon.stream.function.Consumer<com.ing.software.common.TicketError> callback)
        Find the 4 corners of a ticket, ordered counter-clockwise from the top-left corner of the ticket. The corners are ordered to get a straight ticket (but could be upside down). To obtain the corners, call getCorners().
        Parameters:
        quick - - true: faster but more inaccurate: good for real time visual feedback. No orientation detection. - false: slower but more accurate: good for recalculating the rectangle after the shot or for analyzing an imported image.
        callback - callback with TicketError argument called when computation is finished. The error can be NONE or RECT_NOT_FOUND.

      • setCorners

        public com.ing.software.common.TicketError setCorners(java.util.List<android.graphics.Point> corners)
        Set rectangle corners.
        Parameters:
        corners - must be 4, ordered counter-clockwise, first is top-left of ticket.
        Returns:
        TicketError. NONE: corners are valid. INVALID_CORNERS: corners are != 4 or not ordered counter-clockwise.

      • getCorners

        public java.util.List<android.graphics.Point> getCorners()
        Get rectangle corners.
        Returns:
        List of points in bitmap space (range from (0,0) to (width, height) ). The corners might be more or less than 4. Never null.

      • undistort

        public android.graphics.Bitmap undistort(double marginMul)
        Get a Bitmap of a ticket with a perspective correction applied, with a margin.
        Parameters:
        marginMul - fraction of length of shortest side of the rectangle of the ticket. A good value is 0.02
        Returns:
        Bitmap of ticket with perspective distortion removed. Null if error.

      • rotate

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap rotate(android.graphics.Bitmap src,
                                             float angle)
        Rotate a bitmap
        Parameters:
        src - Source bitmap
        angle - Rotation angle (degrees)
        Returns:
        Rotated bitmap
